_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The personal witness in a qualified sens: A mendicant enters and remains in the first absorption
They meditate directly experiencing that dimension in every way
A mendicant enters and remains in the second absorption
They meditate directly experiencing that dimension in every way
A mendicant enters and remains in the third absorption
They meditate directly experiencing that dimension in every way
A mendicant enters and remains in the fourth absorption
They meditate directly experiencing that dimension in every way
A mendicant goes totally beyond perceptions of form
They enter and remain in the dimension of infinite space
They meditate directly experiencing that dimension in every way
A mendicant enters and remains in the dimension of infinite consciousness
They meditate directly experiencing that dimension in every way
A mendicant enters and remains in the dimension of nothingness
They meditate directly experiencing that dimension in every way
A mendicant enters and remains in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception
The personal witness in a definitive sen: A mendicant goes totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception
They enter and remain in the cessation of perception and feeling
They meditate directly experiencing that dimension in every way
Their defilements come to an end
